TITLE: Disabled Python Plugin Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configuration showing how to disable the Python plugin in Devbox.

LANGUAGE: json

TITLE: Executing Test Commands with Devbox
DESCRIPTION: A series of test commands that verify devbox's script execution capabilities. Each command tests a different aspect of devbox's functionality, including running single-line scripts, multi-line scripts, init hooks, and using installed packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/run/script.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# A single-line script should execute
exec devbox run single_line
stdout 'single line'

# A multi-line script should execute
exec devbox run multi_line
stdout 'second line'
stdout 'first line'

# Ensure init hook is being run
exec devbox run hook_runs
stdout 'hook'

# Use a package installed by devbox through a script
exec devbox run hello_with_script
stdout 'with script'

# Use a package installed by devbox directly
exec devbox run -- hello -g directly
stdout 'directly'

# TBD: Bad init hook should result in non-zero exit code
#exec devbox --config bad_init run test
#! stdout 'test'
```

TITLE: Adding Packages with Devbox CLI in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using the 'devbox add' command to add packages to a devbox environment. Demonstrates adding a single package, specifying platforms, excluding platforms, and installing specific package outputs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/docs/cli_reference/devbox_add.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Add the latest version of the `ripgrep` package
devbox add ripgrep

# Install glibcLocales only on x86_64-linux and aarch64-linux
devbox add glibcLocales --platform x86_64-linux,aarch64-linux

# Exclude busybox from installation on macOS
devbox add busybox --exclude-platform aarch64-darwin,x86_64-darwin

# Install non-default outputs for a package, such as the promtool CLI
devbox add prometheus --outputs=out,cli
```

TITLE: Configuring Platform-Specific Packages in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to include or exclude packages for specific platforms using the platforms and excluded_platforms fields in devbox.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/docs/configuration.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "packages": {
        // Only install busybox on linux
        "busybox": {
            "version": "latest",
            "platforms": ["x86_64-linux", "aarch64-linux"]
        },
        // Exclude UTM on Linux
        "utm": {
            "version": "latest",
            "excluded_platforms": ["x86_64-linux", "aarch64-linux"]
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Devbox Environment for GPU Support
DESCRIPTION: Devbox configuration JSON that specifies required packages for TensorFlow GPU support, including the latest Python, CUDA toolkit, and cuDNN libraries. It also sets various PIP environment variables to control installation behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/languages/python_patch_cuda.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "packages": {
    "python":                   "latest",
    "cudaPackages.cudatoolkit": "latest",
    "cudaPackages.cuda_cudart": {"version": "latest", "outputs": ["lib"]},
    "cudaPackages.cudnn":       {"version": "latest", "outputs": ["lib"]},
    "cudaPackages.libcublas":   {"version": "latest", "outputs": ["lib"]}
  },
  "env": {
    "PIP_DISABLE_PIP_VERSION_CHECK": "1",
    "PIP_NO_CACHE_DIR":              "1",
    "PIP_NO_INPUT":                  "1",
    "PIP_NO_PYTHON_VERSION_WARNING": "1",
    "PIP_ONLY_BINARY":               "tf_nightly",
    "PIP_PROGRESS_BAR":              "off",
    "PIP_REQUIRE_VIRTUALENV":        "1",
    "PIP_ROOT_USER_ACTION":          "ignore",
    "TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL":          "0"
  },
  "shell": {
    "scripts": {
      "venv": ". $VENV_DIR/bin/activate && \"$@\""
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining Package Options Schema in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Outlines the schema for specifying package options when using the map structure for packages in devbox.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/docs/configuration.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
{
    "packages": {
        // If only a version is specified, you can abbreviate the maps as "package_name": "version"
        "package_name": string,
        "package_name": {
            // Version of the package to install. Defaults to "latest"
            "version": string,
            // Whether native library patching is enabled for this package. This defaults to `auto`, but can be overridden to `always` or `never` for individual packages.
            "patch": ["auto" | "always" | "never"],
            // List of platforms to install the package on. Defaults to all platforms
            "platforms": [string],
            // List of platforms to exclude this package from. Defaults to no excluded platforms
            "excluded_platforms": [string],
            // Whether to disable a built-in plugin, if one exists for this package. Defaults to false
            "disable_plugin": boolean
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Testing NumPy Shared Library Dependencies in Devbox
DESCRIPTION: A shell script that tests if Devbox correctly handles native dependencies for Python packages. It installs NumPy as a binary wheel and verifies that it can be imported without missing shared library errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/languages/python_patch_missing_so.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Python Missing Shared Library Test
#
# Install NumPy as a binary wheel using pip and verify that it loads.
# The PIP_ONLY_BINARY environment variable forces downloading the binary wheel.
#
# Naively installing and loading NumPy fails because it cannot find
# libstdc++.so. The nixpkgs Python interpreter doesn't search standard system
# paths, so Devbox must patch it or provide the location of native dependencies.

exec devbox install

# pip install numpy
exec devbox run venv -- pip install numpy==2.1.0
stdout 'Successfully installed numpy'

# run python test script that imports numpy
exec devbox run venv -- python main.py
! stderr 'libstdc\+\+\.so\.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory'
```

```
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Rust Development Environment with Devbox
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up a Rust development environment with Devbox. It installs rustup and libiconv packages, configures the Rust toolchain locally, and provides shell scripts for common Rust commands like testing, running, and building documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/docs/devbox_examples/languages/rust.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "packages": [
        "rustup@latest",
        "libiconv@latest"
    ],
    "shell": {
        "init_hook": [
            "projectDir=$(dirname $(readlink -f \"$0\"))",
            "rustupHomeDir=\"$projectDir\"/.rustup",
            "mkdir -p $rustupHomeDir",
            "export RUSTUP_HOME=$rustupHomeDir",
            "export LIBRARY_PATH=$LIBRARY_PATH:\"$projectDir/nix/profile/default/lib\"",
            "rustup default stable",
            "cargo fetch"
        ],
        "scripts": {
            "test": "cargo test -- --show-output",
            "start" : "cargo run",
            "build-docs": "cargo doc"
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Testing Devbox Package Installation and Execution (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This shell script tests the Devbox package manager's ability to install and run a simple 'hello' package. It checks for initial absence of the package, initializes Devbox, adds the package, and verifies its correct execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/basic/install_hello.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Ensure hello is not found anywhere in the environment
! exec hello
! exec devbox run hello

# Initialize devbox
exec devbox init

# Add the package and run hello with devbox
exec devbox add hello
! exec hello

# Run hello and check it prints the right output
exec devbox run hello
stdout 'Hello, world!'

# Once we have better progress output, we should check that stderr is empty, with:
# ! stderr .+  # No stderr output
# As is, we always print 'Ensuring packages are installed'.
```

TITLE: Adding Packages from Flakes in JSON

LANGUAGE: json

```
    "packages": [
        // Add the default package from a github repository
        "github:numtide/flake-utils",
        // Install a specific attribute or package from a Github hosted flake
        "github:nix-community/fenix#stable.toolchain",
        // Install a package from a specific channel of Nixpkgs
        "github:nixos/nixpkgs/21.05#hello",
        // Install a package form a specific commit of Nixpkgs
        "github:nixos/nixpkgs/5233fd2ba76a3accb5aaa999c00509a11fd0793c#hello",
        // Install a package from a local flake. This should point to a directory that contains a flake.nix file.
        "path:../my-flake#my-package"
    ]
}
```

TITLE: RabbitMQ Service Process Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for process-compose defining the RabbitMQ service and log monitoring processes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/docs/devbox_examples/databases/rabbitmq.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
processes:
  rabbitmq:
    command: "rabbitmq-server"
    availability:
      restart: on_failure
      max_restarts: 5
    daemon: true
    shutdown:
      command: "rabbitmqctl shutdown"
  rabbitmq-logs:
    command: "tail -f $RABBITMQ_LOG_BASE/$RABBITMQ_NODENAME@$(hostname -s).log"
    availability:
      restart: "always"
```

TITLE: Defining Flake Installable Schema in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the schema for the 'flake_installable' object, which contains information needed to install a package as a flake reference. It includes details about the flake reference and the attribute path to the package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/nixhub/resolve-a-package-version.api.mdx#2025-04-14_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "flake_installable": {
    "type": "object",
    "description": "The information needed to install this package as a flake reference.",
    "properties": {
      "ref": {
        "type": "object",
        "description": "The full Nix reference to the flake that contains this package.",
        "properties": {
          "type": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The type of flake reference. Usually this will be `github`."
          },
          "owner": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The owner of the repository that contains the flake. Usually `NixOS`."
          },
          "repo": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "the repository that contains the flake. Usually `nixpkgs`"
          },
          "rev": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The Git revision of the flake. This is usually a commit hash."
          }
        }
      },
      "attr_path": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "The attribute path to the package in the flake. This can be used to install the package with Nix or Devbox."
      }
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Testing Devbox Package Outputs for Prometheus
DESCRIPTION: A test script that demonstrates adding Prometheus with different output configurations in Devbox. It first adds Prometheus with default outputs (which excludes promtool), then adds it with custom 'cli' and 'out' outputs to make promtool available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/add/add_outputs.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
exec devbox init

# Add prometheus with default outputs. It will not have promtool.
exec devbox add prometheus
exec devbox run -- prometheus --version
! exec devbox run -- promtool --version

# Add prometheus with cli and out outputs. It will have promtool as well.
```

TITLE: Rendering API Response Tabs in JSX
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines a React component structure for displaying API response samples. It uses nested tab components to organize responses by status code and MIME type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/nixhub/search-packages.api.mdx#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<ApiTabs>
  <TabItem label={"200"} value={"200"}>
    <div>
      <MimeTabs schemaType={"response"}>
        <TabItem label={"application/json"} value={"application/json"}>
          <SchemaTabs>
            <TabItem label={"Schema"} value={"Schema"}>
              <details style={{}} data-collapsed={false} open={true}>
                <summary style={{}}>
                  <strong>Schema</strong>
                </summary>
                <div style={{ textAlign: "left", marginLeft: "1rem" }}>
                </div>
                <ul style={{ marginLeft: "1rem" }}>
                  {Object.entries(responseProperties).map(([name, value]) => (
                    <SchemaItem key={name} {...value} name={name} />
                  ))}
                </ul>
              </details>
            </TabItem>
            <TabItem label={"Example (from schema)"} value={"Example (from schema)"}>
              <ResponseSamples responseExample={exampleFromSchema} language={"json"} />
            </TabItem>
            <TabItem label={"Example"} value={"Example"}>
              <ResponseSamples responseExample={example} language={"json"} />
            </TabItem>
          </SchemaTabs>
        </TabItem>
      </MimeTabs>
    </div>
  </TabItem>
</ApiTabs>
```

```
# Add a package that is not part of the Devbox Search index.

json.superset devbox.json expected_devbox1.json

# from the PATH.
! exec rg --version
! exec vim --version

source.path

exec vim --version
json.superset devbox.json expected_devbox2.json
```

TITLE: Testing Environment Variable Passing with Devbox Run
DESCRIPTION: A series of test commands that verify how various environment variables are passed to the devbox run environment. Tests include parent shell variables, DEVBOX_* prefixed variables, variables from devbox.json, and variable precedence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/run/env.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Parent shell vars should leak into the run environment
env HOMETEST=/home/test
env USER=test-user
env FOO=bar
exec devbox run echo '$HOMETEST'
stdout '/home/test'
exec devbox run echo '$USER'
stdout 'test-user'
exec devbox run echo '$FOO'
stdout 'bar'

# DEVBOX_* vars are passed through
env DEVBOX_FOO=baz
exec devbox run echo '$DEVBOX_FOO'
stdout 'baz'

# Vars defined in devbox.json are passed through
env DEVBOX_FEATURE_ENV_CONFIG=1
exec devbox run echo '$CONFIG_VAR1'
stdout 'abc'

# Vars defined in devbox.json that reference another variable are set
env DEVBOX_FEATURE_ENV_CONFIG=1
env DEVBOX_FOO=baz
exec devbox run echo '$CONFIG_VAR2'
stdout 'baz'

# Vars in devbox that refer to $PWD should get the project dir
env PWD=/test-pwd
exec devbox run echo '$CONFIG_VAR3'
! stdout '/test-pwd'

# Variables are applied in order: nix vars, DEVBOX_*, leaked, leakedForShell, fixed/hard-coded vars,
# plugin vars, and config vars. It really only makes sense to test for plugin and config vars order.
# Note that the nginx plugin defines NGINX_CONFDIR, NGINX_PATH_PREFIX, and NGINX_TMPDIR.
env NGINX_TMPDIR="to-be-overwritten-by-plugin"
exec devbox run echo '$NGINX_TMPDIR'
! stdout 'to-be-overwritten-by-plugin'
stdout '/nginx/temp'

exec devbox run echo '$NGINX_CONFDIR'
stdout 'devbox-json-override'
```

TITLE: Testing GPU Support in TensorFlow with Python
DESCRIPTION: Python script that verifies TensorFlow can access GPU hardware. It prints TensorFlow version, CUDA version, cuDNN version, and details about available GPU devices including memory and physical description.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/languages/python_patch_cuda.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import tensorflow as tf

print("TensorFlow Version:", tf.__version__)
print("CUDA Built with:", tf.sysconfig.get_build_info()["cuda_version"])
print("cuDNN Built with:", tf.sysconfig.get_build_info()["cudnn_version"])

from tensorflow.python.client import device_lib

for device in device_lib.list_local_devices():
    if device.device_type == 'GPU':
        print(f"Device: {device.name}")
        print(f"  Type: {device.device_type}")
        print(f"  Memory Limit: {device.memory_limit / (1024**3):.2f} GB")
        print(f"  Description: {device.physical_device_desc}\n")
```

```
# CSS, JS, Images

Allow: /core/*.js$
Allow: /core/*.js?
Allow: /core/*.gif
Allow: /core/*.jpg
Allow: /core/*.jpeg

Disallow: /profiles/

Disallow: /composer/Plugin/ProjectMessage/README.md

Disallow: /user/register
Disallow: /user/password
```

TITLE: PHP Vector Implementation with DS Extension
DESCRIPTION: Example script demonstrating the usage of PHP DS extension's Vector class. Includes extension validation and basic vector operations with iteration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/languages/php.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

// Check that the extension is loaded.
if (!extension_loaded('ds')) {
    echo("ds extension is not enabled");
    exit(0);
}

$vec = new \Ds\Vector(["hello", "world"]);

echo("Original vector elements\n");
foreach ($vec as $idx => $elem) {
  echo("idx: $idx and elem: $elem\n");
}
echo("done\n");
```

TITLE: Defining Custom Nix Flake
DESCRIPTION: This Nix flake definition creates a simple package using the 'hello' program from nixpkgs. It uses flake-utils for multi-system support and sets up nixpkgs as a dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/packages/flakes.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: nix
CODE:
```
{
  description = "Test";

  inputs = {
    nixpkgs.url = "github:NixOS/nixpkgs/nixos-unstable";
    flake-utils.url = "github:numtide/flake-utils";
  };

  outputs = { self, nixpkgs, flake-utils }:
    flake-utils.lib.eachDefaultSystem (system:
      let
        pkgs = nixpkgs.legacyPackages.${system};
      in
      {
        packages = {
          default = pkgs.hello;
        };
      });
}
```

TITLE: Testing Devbox Package Version Update
DESCRIPTION: This bash script tests the devbox package version update process. It starts with Go 1.19, verifies its presence in the lockfile, then updates to Go 1.20 and checks that the lockfile is updated accordingly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/lockfile/lockfile_tidy.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Testscript to ensure lockfile is updated to remove the older version of a package

# start with a devbox.json having go@1.19
cp devbox_original.json devbox.json
exec devbox install
devboxlock.packages.contains devbox.lock go@1.19

# change devbox.json to instead have go@1.20
cp devbox_changed.json devbox.json
exec devbox install
devboxlock.packages.contains devbox.lock go@1.20
! devboxlock.packages.contains devbox.lock go@1.19
```

TITLE: Verifying PATH Configuration and Command Execution in Devbox Test Environment
DESCRIPTION: This script checks that the PATH environment variable contains exactly one entry as expected by the testing framework. It verifies that the 'devbox' command is accessible while ensuring other common utilities like 'grep' and 'echo' are not available, confirming proper environment isolation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/basic/default_test_env.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# PATH should have a single entry: the one setup by the testing framework
env.path.len 1

# Through that path we should be able to execute devbox:
exec devbox version

# But nothing else (including common tools):
! exec grep --version
! exec echo "echo should not be in path"
```

TITLE: Defining Platform Schema in JSX for Nix Package Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the schema for a platform object within a package release. It includes properties such as architecture, operating system, Nix system name, attribute path, commit hash, and last update date.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/nixhub/get-a-package.api.mdx#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<SchemaItem
  collapsible={false}
  name={"arch"}
  required={false}
  schemaName={"string"}
  qualifierMessage={undefined}
  schema={{"type":"string","description":"The chip architecture of the platform. This will be one of `arm64` or `x86-64`."}}
>
  
</SchemaItem>
```

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<SchemaItem
  collapsible={false}
  name={"os"}
  required={false}
  schemaName={"string"}
  qualifierMessage={undefined}
  schema={{"type":"string","description":"The operating system of the platform. This will be one of `macOS` or `Linux`."}}
>
  
</SchemaItem>
```

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<SchemaItem
  collapsible={false}
  name={"systems"}
  required={false}
  schemaName={"string"}
  qualifierMessage={undefined}
  schema={{"type":"string","description":"The full Nix compatible name of the system. This will be one of `aarch64-darwin`, `aarch64-linux`, `x86_64-darwin`, or `x86_64-linux`."}}
>
  
</SchemaItem>
```

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<SchemaItem
  collapsible={false}
  name={"attribute_path"}
  required={false}
  schemaName={"string"}
  qualifierMessage={undefined}
  schema={{"type":"string","description":"The attribute path to the package in the Nixpkgs. This can be used to install the package with Nix or Devbox."}}
>
  
</SchemaItem>
```

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<SchemaItem
  collapsible={false}
  name={"commit_hash"}
  required={false}
  schemaName={"string"}
  qualifierMessage={undefined}
  schema={{"type":"string","description":"The hash of the Nixpkgs commit that this package was last updated in."}}
>
  
</SchemaItem>
```

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<SchemaItem
  collapsible={false}
  name={"date"}
  required={false}
  schemaName={"string"}
  qualifierMessage={undefined}
  schema={{"type":"string","description":"The date this package was last updated in Nixpkgs."}}
>
  
</SchemaItem>
```

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
---
layout: page
title: About
permalink: /about/
---
```

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Structure
DESCRIPTION: Basic changelog structure with unreleased section and initial version placeholder following Keep a Changelog format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/examples/development/haskell/my-project/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Changelog for `my-project`

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to the
[Haskell Package Versioning Policy](https://pvp.haskell.org/).

## Unreleased

## 0.1.0.0 - YYYY-MM-DD
```

TITLE: Expected Final Devbox Configuration After Adding All Packages
DESCRIPTION: The expected final Devbox configuration after adding both the non-indexed package and regular packages (ripgrep and vim).
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/testscripts/add/add.test.txt#2025-04-14_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "packages": [
    "ripgrep@latest",
    "vim@latest",
    "stdenv.cc.cc.lib"
  ]
}
```

TITLE: Disabling Apache Plugin in Devbox Configuration
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration snippet showing how to disable the Apache plugin in your devbox.json file while keeping the Apache package installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/jetify-com/devbox/blob/main/docs/app/docs/devbox_examples/servers/apache.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "packages": {
    "apache": {
      "version": "latest",
      "disable_plugin": true
    }
  }
}
```
